page.title: 02KENN AND KENNFORD VILLAGES
page.content: THE VILLAGES OF KENN AND KENNFORD SNUGGLE UNDER THE STEEP ESCARPMENT OF THE HALDON HILLS RISING ABOUT 1KM SOUTH OF THEM. THEY ARE PICTURESQUE VILLAGES WITH A POPULATION OF ABOUT 1200 PEOPLE. THEY COME UNDER THE CARE OF TEIGNBRIDGE DISTRICT COUNCIL. THE POPULATION COVERS ALL AGES FROM YOUNG CHILDREN TO RETIRED PEOPLE. MANY OF THE HOUSES ARE BUILT OF DEVON COB AND MANY HAVE THATCHED ROOFS.THE VILLAGES ADJOIN THE MAJOR HIGHWAY THE A38 WHICH LINKS TO OTHER PARTS OF THE COUNTRY. THE PEOPLE HAVE MIXED FEELINGS AS TO THE WORTH OF THE ROAD. TO SOME IT BRINGS NOISE AND UNWANTED VISITORS, TO OTHERS IT IS A LINK TO ARES OUTSIDE DEVON. THE LEISURE ACTIVITIES OF THE VILLAGERS COVER SPORTS,GARDENING, AND STAMPCOLLECTING. TO SOME THE VILLAGES ARE A RETREAT FROM THE NEARBY CITY OF EXETER.
